Description: Come in, warm up, shake it off, and remember how to dance!
Bring your instrument, voice, or tap shoes and join in.

Long Title: The Piano Lesson, an August Wilson Film
Description: Based on a play by August Wilson, The Piano Lesson focuses on the tension building in a few rooms of an African American household as the family members negotiate how to pave their future while not forgetting the past. The only other location shown is the Crawford Grill where some relief from the external world is felt, and the full range of emotion through dance is seen.  There will be Q&A after the film.

Long Title: Queens of the Nightclub– Shake Dancers & Strippers in the Continuum of Black Dance and Entertainment
Description: What is a Shake Dancer? What is the history of contemporary American Strippers? Queens of the Nightclub is a research project about the historical connections between Jazz clubs and ‘the club’. It is a Black, queer, sex workers’ history of erotic improvisation and stage entertainment during the 20th century.

Come find ways to add to your anti-racism practices and how you engage with history & Black culture in, and beyond, dance! In this discussion-based class, we'll introduce frameworks for reflecting and taking action, ideas of how we can do this work together, and how to overcome barriers we may have encountered. You'll come away with a personal 'why' statement, ideas for actions, & accountability buddies for your next steps. This class is for all dance community members, whether you're a teacher/DJ/organizer or not.
Customize your very own Lindy Focus T-Shirt.  It could be just for you, or it could be for your team/scene.

Long Title: Creating Accessible Spaces– A Practical Guide
Description: This workshop will explore practical strategies for making events and spaces more accessible for individuals with disabilities. Participants will gain a deeper understanding of accessibility, practice identifying barriers to physical, social, and sensory accessibility, and discuss solutions using real world examples.
Not Needed

Short Title: Shootin’ The Sh!t with David Butts
Description: An old expression meant to convey passing the time with banter. We’ll ask all sorts of random questions you didn’t know you wanted the answers to and we’ll watch some clips (his? Ours? Yours? Come find out!) and collect his thoughts. This will not be your typical interview with an elder!
Fast Tempo Swing (190 BPM) - open dance practice for all campers.
Dedicated practice for the Performance Tracks.
Open blues dance practice for all campers.

Long Title: Balboa In Color– The Hidden Story of Culture and Diversity in SoCal Swing Dancing
Description: Believe it or not, Balboa has a colorful origin story! Come learn about the obscured history of the diverse contributors to this beloved dance and why it matters to shed light on racial and ethnic erasure in the dance scene.
How well do you know your swing tunes? Tom will put you to test the test in this fun team music challenge.
If you identify as Black, come with your lunch and get some quality time with your peers and guest of honor, David Butts! Community building over food, games, dance, and conversations. 🙂

Short Title: Creating Safe Spaces & Addressing Mental Health Concerns
Description: A workshop focused on strategies for creating safe and welcoming spaces at events, addressing potential challenges, and promoting inclusivity. Additionally, attendees will learn the skills to identify, understand, and respond to their mental health needs.

Short Title: Special Free Class with David Butts!
Description: We don't have a description for you other than you should probably learn anything David Butts wants to teach.
You've done Rock, Paper, Scissors as an individual, but have you done it as a team?  It is a race to the finish, and only you and your teammates can defend your kingdom!  (5 players per team)
Medium Tempo Swing (160 BPM) - open dance practice for all campers.
Open blues dance practice for all campers.
Dedicated practice for the Performance Tracks.

Short Title: So You Think You Can Dance
Description: Do you have super sweet moves? Are you able to keep your cool when the time is almost out? Fan of balloons? Then you should enter this dance challenge competition which gives you a chance to win a free pass to Lindy Focus next year! Come support (and laugh at your friends) if you don’t feel like playing!

Team speed trivia!  Be the first team to complete the column of trivia questions that include history, vernacular jazz, and hum that tune.  If you get one question wrong, then you must start the column, again. (5 players per team)

This workshop will focus on strategies for effective disability outreach within local communities. Participants will learn about: disability culture, building relationships with organizations and advocates, creating inclusive events, and promoting disability rights and supportive policies.
Not Needed
Medium Tempo Swing (160 BPM) - open dance practice for all campers.
Dedicated practice for the Performance Tracks.
Open blues dance practice for all campers.
The Lindy Focus DJs will lead you through a nuanced discussion on DJing swing and blues music. Newbies and long-timers welcome!

Geoff Newell and Laura Windley share a deep dive into the vibrant Black community in Birmingham, Alabama that rooted what would become Erskine Hawkins’ Bama State Collegians; then, follow the orchestra to New York, where they are embraced by the Black community there and find fame and success as the Erskine Hawkins Orchestra.

Long Title: Intersectionality– What Is It and Why It Matters
Leaders: Jamica, Dee, Dr. Marcia, Madeline, Helen, and Matt
Description: Join the panelists as they discuss their diverse intersectional backgrounds and the special considerations that they have while navigating the dance world, and in turn, the special considerations that instructors and organizers might want to consider in their programming. If you have felt panels and presentations at dance events regarding diverse populations have lacked nuance or complexity, this session is for you!
Not Needed

Do you have trouble finding your scene at events, or do you just want to express your joy and pride?  Come make a scene flag! You can also use it show off any Lindy Focus pin that your scene has earned.
Join the blues instructors and DJs as they share their favorite media by contextualizing them and explaining why the clip or audio is so valuable to the blues tradition.
Fast Tempo Swing (190 BPM) - open dance practice for all campers.
Dedicated practice for the Performance Tracks.
Open blues dance practice for all campers.
Probably something fun that you can sing along with.
It's been a long week - let Marcia lead you through a body-focused stretching session for some restoration.

Got some swing dance stuff you're ready to part ways with? Want to score some sweet deals on dance gear? Then join us for the Community Yard Sale at Lindy Focus! The sale will take place on December 31st in Blue Ridge. Set up starts at 10 AM, the sale runs from 11 AM to 2 PM, and the breakdown is from 2 to 2:40 PM. Bring your old dance shoes, clothes, accessories, bags, books, DVDs, CDs, vinyl records, and posters to sell, barter, or gift away. Then shop around to see what new-to-you dance treasures you can bring home. Let's clean out our closets and find new homes for our dance gear!

Leaders: Jamica, Jon, Julie, Kenneth, Ryan, Dee, and Matt
Description: Organizing is hard work and it is too easy to get absorbed in your own event and lose sight of what is happening elsewhere. This session is to focus on the good, bad, and ugly of organizing by inviting veteran organizers to exchange stories and advice. If you are a fellow organizer or would like to be one, then this is a session you don’t want to miss! Consider this a follow up to last year’s successful organizer session, so it will aim to be more in depth and interactive for attendees, everyone is welcome even if they missed last year’s.

Back again, the elaborate music trivia game to test your knowledge on all things jazz history in multiple formats (true/false, multiple choice of images, audio, dates, etc) will reward the person with the most points with a free pass to next year’s Lindy Focus! Start your training!
